com.analog.lyric.collect

Class ArrayUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.collect.ArrayUtil

  • public abstract class ArrayUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static utility methods pertaining to arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • allocateArrayOfType

        public static <T> T[] allocateArrayOfType(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                          @Nullable
                          T[] array,
                          int minSize)
        Returns an array with length at least minSize and with component type compatible with type.

        If array fits the above description, it will simply be returned. If array is too short but has a compatible component type, this will return a new array with length equal to minSize and component type the same as array. Otherwise returns a new array with component type same as type.

      • allFuzzyEqual

        public static boolean allFuzzyEqual(double[] array,
                    double tolerance)
        True if all values in array are DoubleMath.fuzzyEquals(double, double, double) to each other with given tolerance. Returns true for arrays of less than length 2.
        See Also:
        subsetFuzzyEqual(double[], int[], double)

      • contractSortedIndexList

        public static int[] contractSortedIndexList(int[] list,
                            int[] remove)
        Given an array of non-negative array indices in ascending order, and another sorted list of indices of entries to be removed, this returns a new array containing the new values of the remaining indices

        For example, given the original list [0, 1, 3] and the removed list [1,2], this will return [0,1].

        Parameters:
        list - is the starting list of non-negative indices in ascending order.
        remove - is a non-empty list of indexes to be removed also in ascending order.
        Returns:
        a newly allocated array.
        Since:
        0.05

      • copy

        public static <T> T[] copy(java.lang.Class<T> componentType,
           java.util.Collection<T> collection)
        Copies contents of collection into a new array with given component type.
        Since:
        0.05

      • copyFromIndices

        public static <T> T[] copyFromIndices(T[] source,
                      int[] sourceIndices)
        Copies entries from source array at specified sourceIndices to new array.
        Parameters:
        source - is the array from which entries will be copied.
        sourceIndices - specifies which entries to copy into new array in which order. Each index value must be in the range [0,source.length-1] and indicates which entry is to be copied into the corresponding destination.
        Returns:
        new array
        Since:
        0.05
        See Also:
        copyFromIndices(Object[], int[], Object[])

      • copyFromIndices

        public static <T> T[] copyFromIndices(T[] source,
                      int[] sourceIndices,
                      @Nullable
                      T[] destination)
        Copies entries from source array at specified sourceIndices to destination array.
        Parameters:
        source - is the array from which entries will be copied.
        sourceIndices - must be the same length as destination array (if not null). Each index value must be in the range [0,source.length-1] and indicates which entry is to be copied into the corresponding destination.
        destination - is the array into which the entries are to be copied. If null, then a new one will be allocated using same type as source and length matching that of sourceIndices.
        Returns:
        array into which values have been copied. Will be same as destination if not null.
        Since:
        0.05
        See Also:
        copyFromIndices(Object[], int[])

      • linearSearch

        public static <K> int linearSearch(IKeyed<K>[] array,
                   K key,
                   int fromIndex,
                   int toIndex)
        Searches array in linear order for first element with matching key.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be searched
        key - the value to be searched for
        fromIndex - the index of the first element (inclusive) to be searched
        toIndex - the index of the last element (exclusive) to be searched
        Returns:
        index of first array element in range for which key.equals(array[i].getKey()); otherwise -1.
        Since:
        0.06

      • linearSearch

        public static <K> int linearSearch(IKeyed<K>[] array,
                   K key)
        Searches array in linear order for first element with matching key.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be searched
        key - the value to be searched for
        Returns:
        index of first array element for which key.equals(array[i].getKey()); otherwise -1.
        Since:
        0.06

      • isSorted

        public static <T> boolean isSorted(T[] array,
                   java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        Determines if array is ordered according to provided comparator.
        Since:
        0.05

      • isSorted

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> boolean isSorted(T[] array)
        Determines if array is ordered according to elements' Comparable.compareTo(Object) method.
        Since:
        0.05

      • subsetFuzzyEqual

        public static boolean subsetFuzzyEqual(double[] array,
                       int[] arraySubindices,
                       double tolerance)
        True if all values in array whose indices are in arraySubindices are DoubleMath.fuzzyEquals(double, double, double) to each other with given tolerance. Returns true if length of arraySubindices is less than length 2.
        Parameters:
        arraySubindices - must be no larger than array and should contain indexes in the range [0,array.length-1].
        See Also:
        allFuzzyEqual(double[], double)

      • cloneArray

        @Nullable
public static double[] cloneArray(@Nullable
                           double[] array)
        Returns a copy of array returning null if array is null and returns EMPTY_DOUBLE_ARRAY if empty.

      • cloneArray

        @Nullable
public static int[] cloneArray(@Nullable
                        int[] array)
        Returns a copy of array returning null if array is null and returns EMPTY_INT_ARRAY if empty.

      • cloneArray

        @Nullable
public static int[][] cloneArray(@Nullable
                          int[][] array)
        Returns a copy of array returning null if array is null and returns EMPTY_INT_ARRAY_ARRAY if empty. Note that this does not make a deep copy of the array elements.

      • copyArrayForInsert

        public static double[] copyArrayForInsert(@Nullable
                          double[] array,
                          int insertionPoint,
                          int insertLength)
        Returns a copy of array but with space for insertion of insertLength values at offset insertionPoint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if insertionPoint is not in the range [0, array.length].

      • copyArrayForInsert

        public static int[] copyArrayForInsert(@Nullable
                       int[] array,
                       int insertionPoint,
                       int insertLength)
        Returns a copy of array but with space for insertion of insertLength values at offset insertionPoint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if insertionPoint is not in the range [0, array.length].

      • copyArrayForInsert

        public static int[][] copyArrayForInsert(@Nullable
                         int[][] array,
                         int insertionPoint,
                         int insertLength)
        Returns a copy of array but with space for insertion of insertLength values at offset insertionPoint. Note that this does not make a deep copy of the array elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if insertionPoint is not in the range [0, array.length].

      • toArray

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Object[] toArray(@Nullable
                                  java.lang.Object value)

      • toIntArray

        @Nullable
public static int[] toIntArray(@Nullable
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Converts value to an int array or else returns null.

        If value is an int array it will simply be returned. If it is another type of array, whose elements are all integral values, then a new array with those values will be returned. Otherwise returns null.

      • removeIntArrayEntry

        @Internal
public static int[] removeIntArrayEntry(int[] array,
                                 int index)
        Returns a copy of an int array, without the element at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        array - The original array.
        index - The zero-based index of the element to exclude from the copy.
        Since:
        0.06
